title: Camping

verbs: To live in a tent or similar temporary accomodation.
To live in a tent or similar temporary accommodation.
Live in or as if in a tent
nouns: An image created by light falling on a light-sensitive surface or an electronic imager
Image created by light falling on a light-sensitive surface
An image captured by a camera or some other device and reproduced as a picture, usually on a sensitized surface and formed by the chemical action of light or of radiant energy.
A photograph.
A Surface application from Microsoft where users can browse and interact with photos and videos.
A representation of a person or scene in the form of a print or transparent slide; recorded by a camera on light-sensitive material
An image that has been captured electronically with a digital camera or scanner.
A photograph, photo or a picture is an image created by light falling on a light-sensitive surface, usually photographic film or an electronic medium such as a CCD or a CMOS chip.
Photograph.
A picture created by projecting an image onto a photosensitive surface such as a chemically treated plate or film, CCD receptor, etc.
A portable lodging (usually made from waterproof plastic, animal hide or canvas streched by poles) that is used for sheltering people and objects from the weather when camping or at festivals.
Temporary building which can be easily dismantled and which is portable
A tent is a shelter consisting of sheets of fabric or other material draped over, attached to a frame of poles or attached to a supporting rope.
A portable shelter (usually of canvas stretched over supporting poles and fastened to the ground with ropes and pegs)
At a fair or festival, a tent set up for the purpose of selling and consuming beer and other alcoholic beverages.
At a fair or festival, a tent or wood construction in which beer, other alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages and food are served and consumed, often accompanied by a live band.
A pavilion or portable lodge consisting of skins, canvas, or some strong cloth, stretched and sustained by poles, used for sheltering persons from the weather.
Tent set up for the purpose of selling and consuming beer.
Environment outside of enclosed structures.
The environment outside of enclosed structures; the natural environment in the open air.
Where the air is unconfined
Camping is an outdoor recreational activity.
Outdoor recreational activity
Activity of camping
The act of encamping and living in tents in a camp
A bivouac shelter is any of a variety of improvised camp sites such as those used in scouting and mountain climbing.

description: A campsite featuring a tent and a tree, and perhaps a campfire. Similar to the tent emoji.
apple_vendor_description: Apple's camping emoji depicts a cozy, miniature tent rendered with soft rounded edges and a warm, inviting color palette, often featuring a deep forest green and a light tan fabric. Realistic lighting effects on Apple devices highlight the tent's gentle curves and texture, evoking a sense of adventure, nature, and relaxation. It's commonly employed to signal plans for outdoor excursions, express a love for the wilderness, or represent a tranquil escape.
